data.title: Great Value Hotel
data.text: Modern just over a year old. Nice bar, restaurant, room size. Clean. Pool, exercise room and nice lounge. Very comfortable area for discussions , couples or small groups. Also includes a nice Java/Expresso bar too. You can walk to Anthony's Coal fire pizza, la bocca, BLT at the Ritz, among others. Ideal location and Cinema 15 is right around the corner.

data.title: Great Stay for All - Thanks
data.text: We booked a block of rooms for our wedding. We had about 25 rooms, and hosted a brunch the morning after. Every person had great things to say about the hotel. The staff was extremely accommodating to everyone. It was great service - decor - and comfort.

data.title: Weekend get away
data.text: My husband and I stayed at the Cambria Hotel in White Plains NY for a weekend get away.  There was easy access to the subway system to go into NY city.  The rooms were modern and clean.  Heating and Cooling was quiet.  The breakfast is not included in the cost but a free drink was.  There was suppose to be a 24/7 coffee bar but when we tried to get an am coffee before returning the to the airport no one was there to wait on us.

data.title: Great weekend stay
data.text: The location is very convenient to many shops and restaurants. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room was spacious and had an overall nice design. We were very comfortable and would stay here again.

data.title: Very good hotel great location
data.text: I've stayed here at least he a dozen times. Same service same good room all the time. Consistent hotel. Reception is always quick and friendly. Many many eateries in walking distance. Highly recommended.

data.title: Great facility and Great Location
data.text:
My room was spacious and spotless.  I would have given my stay five stars but the air conditioning in my room did not work for three days.  I notified the hotel several times and on the third day sent someone to make a repair.  I was not please with no air conditioning for an end of summer stay, luckily during a cool spell.  

I commend the individual who check me out because who asked about my stay.  When hearing about my issue, they immediately worked to save my impression of my stay by proving me room credit.  I view this as excellent customer service and applaud that individual for valuing my business.  I would recommend this property for its convenience, cleanliness, and the excellent way I was handled by the desk clerk at check out.

data.title: visit for wedding weekend in September
data.text:
Everything about the hotel was perfect. Beautiful rooms, comfortable beds. Sunny at the front desk went out of her way to make it her business to locate and return to us several items left in our room. It was much appreciated!  Would highly recommend this hotel.
Trudy

owner_response.author: Sean M, General Manager at Cambria hotel & suites White Plains - Downtown, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hi trshapiro28, 

Thank you for the kind words about the Cambria Hotel and Suites White Plains Downtown.  We are glad you enjoyed your stay and hope to see you the next time your visit Westchester County.  Thank you for recognizing Sunny.  I will be sure to share your comments with her.  

Best, 

Sean
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: A good choice
data.text:
If you have to stay in White Plains the Cambria Suites is likely your best choice. It’s located right in the heart of downtown White Plains, the reception and staff was great, the rooms are clean and large (although the layout of our room was a little weird, very narrow and long).

You’ll definitely get a good night of sleep as the bed is very comfortable, and the room is very quiet. Could not hear our neighbors, people in the hallway or anything from the street (we weren’t facing the street, which likely helped).

The breakfast was standard but pretty good as well, although not included in the price of our room.

All in all I recommend this hotel, it is a solid choice.

owner_response.author: Sean M, General Manager at Cambria hotel & suites White Plains - Downtown, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hi Phil A, 

Thank you for reviewing the Cambria Hotel and Suites White Plains Downtown.  We enjoy getting feedback from elite level reviewers such as yourself. It makes us happy to hear you received a good night sleep and your stay was comfortable.  Thank you for recommending our hotel and we hope to see you the next time you visit White Plains.  

Best, 

Sean M
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Very nice
data.text: This is truly the gem of the Choice hotel chain.  Lobby was amazing, staff was friendly and helpful.  They were short a shuttle driver so the GM drove us to dinner in his personal car.  Room was great, reasonable rates, I will definitely stay here again if in the area.

owner_response.author: Sean M, General Manager at Cambria hotel & suites White Plains - Downtown, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hi BigDoginOK, 

Thank you for staying at the Cambria Hotel and Suites and also taking the time to review our hotel.  It was a pleasure to take you and your colleagues to dinner on a busy shuttle night for the hotel.  We also appreciate taking the time to share the kind words about our staff.  

Best, 

Sean M
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Excellent hotel and staff
data.text:
From the beginning you know this place is special. I normally stay at the nearby Ritz Carlton so had fairly low expectation of this place. However, front desk are extremely polite, helpful, professional, and although it sound strange to say it, sincere. You get the impression they actually care if you'd had a good trip or a good day rather than just say the words. 

The rooms are nice and spacious and very clean. I guess the gym is a little small, but then they offer free access to a proper gym in the building.

data.title: Very good, but poor shower
data.text:
The hotel had one flaw: The shower had a very low water flow/pressure - very annoying.

Besides that, everything was very good: Large rooms, clean, quiet, good condition of both rooms and common areas, friendly staff. Excellent location, just between the two malls. I also appreciated the free access to the "planet fitness" gym club just under the hotel.

They accidently charged me for parking (I didn't have a car!) and I didn't pay attention to that when checking out. However, when I e-mailed the hotel a few weeks later it just took them a few hours to reply with an updated receipt and re-fund to my credit card - well done!

data.title: Westchester Gem
data.text: My friends and I needed a nice place to stay for a four day golf trip to Westchester. We had previously stayed at the Crown Plaza and it was very nice but The Cambria was GREAT and perfect for a trip to White Plains and Westchester. For the money, a pleasant surprise. New, fresh, great location and valet service.

data.title: The best in hotel White Plains so far
data.text:
I have stayed in White Plains hotels a few times but this was the first on Cambria. 
The bed was one of the best hotel beds I have ever slept in, top class.
The room itself was nice, clean and silent except from a bit of noise from the street, and if you like it really silent you would have to turn off the AC, but that I have had to do in all hotels from visiting USA several times per year.
Another fact is that the shower is by American standard a wall mounted piece with poor function and a water temperature that is changing, a lot. This I reported and it was fixed during the day, hence worked better the next time I took a shower, but I still would appreciate a hand held shower and a real thermostat installed.
Very nice staff in all functions, great breakfast and indoor parking appreciated.
A bit expensive compared to European standard in comparison, additional tax, parking and breakfast is added, however cheaper than other hotels in the region.

data.title: Great Location
data.text:
This hotel is in a  great location.  
First of all you can walk everywhere. Second the hotel is less ten ten years old. Also the service is very good. Fourth the rooms are clean. Last it id a fun place to stay.

owner_response.author: Sean M, General Manager at Cambria hotel & suites White Plains - Downtown, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hi London057, 

Thank you for the kind review and we look forward to welcoming you back again to the Cambria Hotel and Suites White Plains Downtown the next time you visit the area.  
We are happy that you enjoyed a comfortable stay and found our location convenient.  

Best Regards, 

Sean M
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Met a friend here for drinks and a bite to eat.
data.text: The bar area has a nice long bar and then there are tables set up if you want to be waited on.  We stayed at the bar which was well lit, bright and staff was very friendly.  Ordered a couple of sandwiches which were great tasting and good portions.  Also had a dessert which was shared by both - might have been too much for just one person.  Overall had a great time at the bar.  Only drawback was as a guest not staying had to pay $ 10 plus tax for valet.  Next time I'll just park at the adjoining shopping center and pay $ 1.00 per hour.

owner_response.author: Sean M, General Manager at Cambria hotel & suites White Plains - Downtown, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hi h0ylandm, 

It’s nice that hear our delicious cuisine was to your liking and of good value. Thank you for the review and we hope to welcome you back again to the Cambria Hotel and Suites the next time you are in the area.  

Best, 

Sean M
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Absolutely Loved Everything About It!
data.text:
Parking was simple. Check in was a breeze. The front desk associates were friendly, efficient, and made us feel very welcome. They even took our cell phone number so we could easily keep in touch with any needs or questions.  

Our room was immaculate, welcoming, and spacious. Bed was incredibly comfortable.  They thought of everything to ensure a good night's sleep. Even the pillows were different densities.

The breakfast buffet was delicious. There was a variety of options - from fresh fruit and yogurt to eggs, french toast, bagels and pastries.  If it is a nice day, be sure to take your breakfast outdoors.  

The location is close to many restaurants, nightlife, and shopping. It is also only a short walk to the train station if you want to head into the city for the day. My family and I came here for a few days of R&R and I am pleased to say this was the perfect selection. We will most definitely be back.

owner_response.author: Sean M, General Manager at Cambria hotel & suites White Plains - Downtown, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hi Jennibear2, 

Thank you for leaving such a detailed and wonderful review for the Trip Advisor community to read.  I will be sure to share your comments with our entire team during our next luncheon.  We look forward to welcoming you back again soon to the Cambria Hotel and Suites White Plains Downtown. 

Best, 

Sean
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Comfort and convienence in downtown city atmosphere
data.text: The location is in a downtown city area with all the local amenities you would expect. The underground valet parking is convenient, and the restaurant serves a nice variety of food including  great breakfast buffet. As always the staff is friendlessriendly and helpful. Hats off to Sunny at the front desk who makes you smile even on a bad day and Kristen who goes the extra mile to find a room no matter what!

owner_response.author: Sean M, General Manager at Cambria hotel & suites White Plains - Downtown, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hi MikefromBoston7457, 

We are happy that you enjoyed a comfortable stay and found our location convenient.  I am happy to hear that Sunny and Kristin were able to go above and beyond to make your stay extra enjoyable! Thank you for the kind review and we look forward to welcoming you back again to the Cambria Hotel and Suites White Plains Downtown the next time you visit the area.


Best, 

Sean M
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great modern hotel
data.text: I really liked this hotel, The decor was modern, the room was clean and service was good.  Valet parking is free and very organized. The patio bar is pleasant, with good service, The location worked well for a visit with family in nearby Rye.

owner_response.author: Sean M, General Manager at Cambria hotel & suites White Plains - Downtown, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hi Ehillets, 

Thank you for the kind review of the Cambria Hotel and Suites.  Our newly furnished patio overlooking downtown White Plains has been extremely popular with our guests to dine and for drinks as well.  We hope to see you on your next visit to Westchester County.  Valet parking is normally $20, but offer inclusive rates from time to time. I am glad you were able to take advantage of the offer! 

Best, 

Sean M
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Excellent Place to stay!
data.text:
Excellent place to stay in White Plains area.  Close to downtown, walking distance from several stores and restaurants.  

Staff is very friendly and accommodating.  Room are spacious and always very clean.  Also includes access to Crunch fitness which is a bonus.

Highly recommend staying here!

owner_response.author: Sean M, General Manager at Cambria hotel & suites White Plains - Downtown, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hi Dave F, 

We are very happy that you enjoyed an overall comfortable stay and found our location convenient for your travel needs. Your mentioned our friendly and accommodating staff.  This is greatly appreciated, thank you. It would be a pleasure to welcome you back the next time you visit the area.

Best ,

Sean M
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great place to stay
data.text: I booked two rooms for my daughter's 17 th birthday, one for myself and one for my daughter and four of her friends. The suites accommodated my daughter and her friends perfectly. There were two queen beds and a sitting area with a comfortable pullout couch. There was a refrigerator for snacks and drinks as well as a microwave. The hotel is in the heart of downtown so the girls had plenty to do. The rooms were clean and modern. The staff was friendly and accommodating.
